FuncDef:
The trust command specifies the priority to be mapped for packets.
The undo trust command cancels the configuration. The trust command specifies the priority to be mapped for packets. The undo trust command cancels the configuration. By default, packets are processed based on the mapping of the outer 802.1p priority.
ParentView: Layer 2 100GE interface view,100ge sub-interface view,Layer 2 10GE interface view,10GE sub-interface view,Layer 2 200GE interface view,200GE sub-interface view,25GE-L2 view,25GE sub-interface view,400GE-L2 view,400GE sub-interface view,Layer 2 50GE interface view,50GE sub-interface view,Layer 2 Eth-Trunk interface view,Eth-Trunk sub-interface view,Layer 2 sub-interface view,Interface group view

ParaDef.Info:
Maps packets based on the 802.1p priority.
-

Maps packets based on the inner 802.1p priority.

 NOTE: This parameter is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
-

Maps packets based on the outer 802.1p priority.
-

Maps packets based on the DSCP priority.
-

ExtraInfo:
A DiffServ domain defines the mapping between PHBs/colors and two types of priorities, namely, 802.1p priority and DSCP priority. When the DiffServ domain is bound to an interface, you can run the trust command to specify the priority to be mapped.
To set the same priority to be trusted on multiple interfaces, you can perform the configuration on a port group to reduce the workload.
